title: Stiefel manifold
summary: In mathematics, the Stiefel manifold V k ( R n ) {\displaystyle V_{k}(\mathbb {R} ^{n})} is the set of all orthonormal k-frames in R n . {\displaystyle \mathbb {R} ^{n}.} That is, it is the set of ordered orthonormal k-tuples of vectors in R n . {\displaystyle \mathbb {R} ^{n}.} It is named after Swiss mathematician Eduard Stiefel. Likewise one can define the complex Stiefel manifold V k ( C n ) {\displaystyle V_{k}(\mathbb {C} ^{n})} of orthonormal k-frames in C n {\displaystyle \mathbb {C} ^{n}} and the quaternionic Stiefel manifold V k ( H n ) {\displaystyle V_{k}(\mathbb {H} ^{n})} of orthonormal k-frames in H n {\displaystyle \mathbb {H} ^{n}} . More generally, the construction applies to any real, complex, or quaternionic inner product space.
